Run with Workflow runner

request.description: There is no documentation

The route service can be used to find the best way to get from one location to another or to visit several locations. The best route can be the quickest route for a given time of day considering the traffic conditions applicable during that time, or it can be the shortest route that minimizes the travel distance. The route service can also find the best route that visits each stop during permitted time windows you specify. 

[Full description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Route_service_with_synchronous_execution/02r300000036000000/) //
[View JS Demo](http://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/samples/widget_directions_basic/)

[Full description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Service_Area_service_with_synchronous_execution/02r3000000n2000000/) // 
[View JS Demo](http://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/samples/routetask_basic_servicearea/)

[Full description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Closest_Facility_service_with_synchronous_execution/02r3000000n7000000/) //
[View JS Demo](http://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/samples/routetask_closest_facility/)

Geocodes one location per request; the input address is specified in a single parameter.

[Full description of the service](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geocode/api-reference/geocoding-find.htm)
[Full description of the service](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geocode/api-reference/geocoding-geocode-addresses.htm)

[Full description of the service:](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geocode/api-reference/geocoding-reverse-geocode.htm) //
[View JS Demo](http://timw1984.github.io/WebApp-Location/)
[Full description of the service](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geocode/api-reference/geocoding-suggest.htm)
[Description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Input_XY_locations/02r300000006000000/)
[List of variables you can use to geoenrich](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Get_variables/02r300000266000000/)
[Description of the service](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geoenrichment/api-reference/street-address-locations.htm)

The result of this operation is an array of projected geometries. This resource projects an array of input geometries from an input spatial reference to an output spatial reference.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/project.html)

Simplify permanently alters the input geometry so that the geometry becomes topologically consistent. This resource applies the ArcGIS simplify operation to each geometry in the input array. For more information, see ITopologicalOperator.Simplify Method and IPolyline.SimplifyNetwork Method.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/simplify.html)

The result of this operation is buffer polygons at the specified distances for the input geometry array. An option is available to union buffers at each distance.

[Readmore](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/buffer.html)

This operation calculates areas and perimeter lengths for each polygon specified in the input array.
 
 [Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/areasandlengths.html)

This operation calculates the lengths of each polyline specified in the input array.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/lengths.html)

This operation determines the pairs of geometries from the input geometry arrays that participate in the specified spatial relation.

This operation computes the set of pairs of geometries from geometries1 and geometries2 that belong to the specified relation. Both arrays are assumed to be in the spatial reference specified by sr, which is a required parameter. The relations are evaluated in 2D. Z coordinates are not used. Geometry types cannot be mixed within an array.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/relation.html)

This operation calculates an interior point for each polygon specified in the input array. These interior points can be used by clients for labeling the polygons.
 
 [Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/labelpoints.html)

The AutoComplete operation simplifies the process of constructing new polygons that are adjacent to other polygons. It constructs polygons that fill in the gaps between existing polygons and a set of polylines.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/autoComplete.html)

It returns the convex hull of the input geometry. The input geometry can be a point, multipoint, polyline or polygon. The hull is typically a polygon but can also be a polyline or point in degenerate cases.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/convexHull.html)
This operation splits the input polyline or polygon where it crosses a cutting polyline

This operation densifies geometries by plotting points between existing vertices.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/densify.html)

This operation constructs the set-theoretic difference between an array of geometries and another geometry.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/difference.html)

It returns generalized (Douglas-Poiker) versions of the input geometries.
 
 [Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/generalize.html)

This operation constructs the set-theoretic intersection between an array of geometries and another geometry

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/intersect.html)

Offset constructs the offset of the given input geometries. If the offset parameter is positive the constructed offset will be on the right side of the geometry. (Left side offsets are constructed with negative parameters.) Tracing the geometry from it's first vertex to the last will give you a direction along the geometry. It is to the right and left perspective of this direction that the positive and negative parameters will dictate where the offset is contructed. In these terms it is simple to infer where the offset of even horizontal geometries will be constructed. The offsetHow parameter determines how outer corners between segments are handled. Rounded offset rounds the corner between extended offsets. Bevelled offset squares off the corner after a given ratio distance. Mitered offset attempts to allow extended offsets to naturally intersect, but if that intersection occurs too far from the corner, the corner is eventually bevelled off at a fixed distance.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/offset.html)

It reshapes a polyline or a part of a polygon using a reshaping line.
 
 [Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/reshape.html)

This operation trims / extends each polyline specified in the input array, using the user specified guide polylines. When trimming features, the part to the left of the oriented cutting line is preserved in the output and the other part is discarded. An empty polyline is added to the output array if the corresponding input polyline is neither cut nor extended.

[Read more](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/trimExtend.html)

This operation constructs the set-theoretic union of the geometries in the input array. All inputs must be of the same type.

[Readme](http://tasks.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/SDK/REST/union.html)
[Full description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Generate_Token/02r3000000m5000000/)
[Full description of the service](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Generate_Token/02r3000001w0000000/)
[Más info](https://developers.arcgis.com/authentication/)
[Más info](https://developers.arcgis.com/authentication/)

item.name: Check if an App is Registered

exec: tests["Not a registered app"] = jsonData.error.message === "Not a registered app";
tests["It is a registered app"] = "It is a registered app";

request.description:
The searches are performed against a high performance index that indexes the most popular fields of an item. See the [Search reference](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/02r3/02r3000000mn000000.htm) page for information on the fields and the syntax of the query.

[Read more](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Search/02r3000000mp000000/)

A user resource representing a registered user of the portal.
Personal details of the user, such as e-mail and groups, are returned only to the user or the administrator of the user's organization (the properties in the Response Properties table below).

[Read more](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User/02r3000000m2000000/)

A user resource representing a registered user of the portal.
Personal details of the user, such as e-mail and groups, are returned only to the user or the administrator of the user's organization (the properties in the Response Properties table below).

Administration token is needed

[Read more](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User/02r3000000m2000000/)

item.name: Add item (Ready to use - Configurable WebApp)

urlencoded.value: Web Map, Map, Online Map, Mapping Site, JavaScript, Ready To Use ,selfConfigured

request.description:
Map Journal, /share and /update item URL is required (with the returned item id)

**Share**: Something like this:
everyone:true
org:false
items:16818d5144cb44c89bafb86b38ca5468

**Update** Something like this:
url = http://{{username}}.maps.arcgis.com/apps/MapJournal/index.html?appid=<item-id>
id = <item-id>

item.name: Invite an user to an Organization

urlencoded.value: Invitation to join an ArcGIS Online organization

XXXX has invited you to join an ArcGIS Online Organization, Map GeoGeeks from Spain.

Please click this link to finish setting up your account and establish your password: https://www.arcgis.com/home/newuser.html?invitation=@@invitation.id@@

Note that your account has already been created for you with the username, @@touser.username@@.

If you have difficulty signing in, please contact Raúl Jiménez (raul.jimenez@esri.es). Be sure to include a description of the problem, the error message, and a screenshot.

For your reference, you can access the home page of the organization here:
https://geogeeks.maps.arcgis.com/home/

This link will expire in two weeks.

This is an automated email. Please do not reply.

request.description: [Export webmap task](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/rest/apiref/gp_exportwebmaptask.html)

The Calculate Density task takes known quantities of some phenomenon and spreads these quantities across the map. You can use this task, for example, to show concentrations of lightning strikes or tornados, access to health care facilities, and population densities.

[Read more](https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/analysis/api-reference/calculate-density.htm)

urlencoded.value: {"attributeParameterValues":[{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Avoid Unpaved Roads","value":"AVOID_HIGH"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Avoid Private Roads","value":"AVOID_MEDIUM"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Driving an Automobile","value":"PROHIBITED"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Through Traffic Prohibited","value":"AVOID_HIGH"},{"parameterName":"Vehicle Maximum Speed (km/h)","attributeName":"TravelTime","value":0},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Roads Under Construction Prohibited","value":"PROHIBITED"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Avoid Gates","value":"AVOID_MEDIUM"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Avoid Express Lanes","value":"PROHIBITED"},{"parameterName":"Restriction Usage","attributeName":"Avoid Carpool Roads","value":"PROHIBITED"}],"description":"Models the movement of cars and other similar small automobiles, such as pickup trucks, and finds solutions that optimize travel time. Travel obeys one-way roads, avoids illegal turns, and follows other rules that are specific to cars. When you specify a start time, dynamic travel speeds based on traffic are used where it is available.","impedanceAttributeName":"TravelTime","simplificationToleranceUnits":"esriMeters","uturnAtJunctions":"esriNFSBAtDeadEndsAndIntersections","restrictionAttributeNames":["Avoid Unpaved Roads","Avoid Private Roads","Driving an Automobile","Through Traffic Prohibited","Roads Under Construction Prohibited","Avoid Gates","Avoid Express Lanes","Avoid Carpool Roads"],"useHierarchy":true,"simplificationTolerance":10,"timeAttributeName":"TravelTime","distanceAttributeName":"Kilometers","type":"AUTOMOBILE","id":"FEgifRtFndKNcJMJ","name":"Driving Time"}
